title: Linux mkfs Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the mkfs command in Linux, learn how to create file systems on partitions and format USB drives, and gain practical experience with hands-on examples.

verify.name: Verify available file system types
verify.hint: The available file system types should include "ext4". Please check the output of the "sudo mkfs.types" command.

steps.title: Creating a Filesystem on a Partition

verify.name: Verify file system creation
verify.hint: The file system should have been created on the /dev/sdb1 partition. Please check the output of the "sudo blkid" command.

steps.title: Formatting a USB Drive with the mkfs Command

verify.name: Verify USB drive formatting
verify.hint: The USB drive should have been formatted with the FAT32 file system. Please check the output of the "sudo blkid" command.
